title: Easy Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream Recipe
description: This homemade ice cream uses sweetened condensed milk for an easy way to make egg-free ice cream with just 3 simple ingredients and no cooking required.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips EAGLE BRAND® Easy Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream 4.5 (276) 229 Reviews 10 Photos Use this sweetened condensed milk ice cream recipe to make vanilla ice cream, or add your favorite flavors. Submitted by Eagle brand Updated on June 27, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 1/2 quarts Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 4 cups half-and-half or light cream 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND Sweetened Condensed Milk 2 tablespoons vanilla extract Directions Combine half-and-half, condensed milk, and vanilla in a large bowl; mix well. Pour into an ice cream freezer container. Freeze according to manufacturer's instructions. Recipe Tip Refrigerator-Freezer Method: Omit half-and-half. Combine sweetened condensed milk and vanilla in a large bowl; mix well. Fold in 2 cups whipping cream. Pour into a 9x5-inch loaf pan or 2-quart container; cover. Freeze until firm, about 6 hours. I Made It Print 551 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 263 Calories 13g Fat 14g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 263 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 16% Saturated Fat 8g 41% Cholesterol 42mg 14% Sodium 80mg 3% Total Carbohydrate 14g 5% Total Sugars 11g Protein 4g 8% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 85mg 7% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 108mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream 01 of 10 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 10 Photo by  Brittany Anne 08/25/2020 We started to make the non ice cream maker one only to realize that we were suppose to whip the whipping cream before folding it into the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla mixture. So then we added it it our ice cream maker. What we ended up with was a delicious and creamy vanilla ice cream that pleased all 6 of us! My oldest said it had a “marshmallow vibe. We also made a mint chocolate cookie frozen custard(we dyed it purple instead of green, because why not) and made mixed cones. Super happy tummies in this house 03 of 10 Photo by  MissCooksAlot 06/11/2017 04 of 10 Photo by  Connor Waldron 06/01/2017 05 of 10 Photo by  Tyler Ehlers 08/27/2016 06 of 10 Photo by  Angel Faul 02/19/2016 07 of 10 Photo by  pomplemousse 08/12/2012 Very nice. I only had half the amount of light cream called for, so I just halved the recipe. Instead of vanilla extract, I used the seeds/whatever you scrape from a vanilla bean instead. It had a lovely vanilla flavor that way. Husband was complaining it was gritty, but I think that is bc he was eating it before placing it back in the freezer--ice cream making is a process for a reason! Otherwise, he liked it. He added in M&Ms apparently bc he could. I tried it and thought it was good, but can't have much of it due to being lactose intolerant. Thanks for the recipe! 08 of 10 Photo by  JARRIE 07/30/2010 Not bad. Not actually good either. It would be better if it had more fat in it, and that's the honest truth. Nothing wrong with the flavor, if you want more vanilla, add more vanilla. Taste the mixture before you freeze it to make sure it tastes vanilla enough. Really if you want to use this recipe and you want it to be creamy, use 2 cups half&half and 2 cups heavy cream or whipping cream (not whipped cream, not Cool Whip!) rather than 4 of half&half, it'll improve the texture. This ice cream is best enjoyed the day it's made -- after that it gets crystallized. Thanks for the recipe! 09 of 10 Photo by  Michelle Ramey 07/31/2005 I love this recipe! So incredibly easy, so I was thinking it can't be that good. But it is! I love how it doesn't require eggs or cooking. Just dump everything into a bowl, stir, and put it in your ice cream maker. The flavor is so rich and delicious. Upon first bite my husband proclaimed "We're never buying store-bought ice cream again!" Next I want to try using whole milk instead of half and half, and adding fruits or other goodies. 1 You’ll Also Love Caramel Apple Ice Cream 7 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Ice Cream Sandwich Dessert 3 Ratings Eagle Brand Chocolate Fondue 195 Ratings Eagle Brand Lemon Cream Pie 45 Ratings Seven Layer Cookie Bars 271 Ratings Caramel Flans from EAGLE BRAND 11 Ratings Caramel Apple Streusel Squares 9 Ratings Foolproof Chocolate Fudge 245 Ratings Easy Creamy Banana Pudding 190 Ratings Blueberry Streusel Cobbler 109 Ratings Banana Coconut Cream Pie 53 Ratings Classic Key Lime Pie 133 Ratings Eagle Brand Chocolate Truffles 27 Ratings Chocolate Swirled Peppermint Fudge 5 Ratings Sweet Potato Pie from Eagle Brand 101 Ratings Eagle Brand Peanut Butter Fudge 116 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Eagle brand
instructions: Combine half-and-half, condensed milk, and vanilla in a large bowl; mix well. Pour into an ice cream freezer container. Freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.
